Course: LHD - Learning Half Day - From stressed to supported
Description: In today’s fast-paced and demanding environments, stress can quickly become overwhelming—especially when support feels limited or out of reach. This session focuses on practical ways to move from stress and pressure toward greater support, resilience, and connection.
Trainer: Health and Wellbeing Team deivered by HALSA Wellbeing

Course: LHD - Learning Half Day - Cardiovascular Health
Description: This session focuses on blood pressure and cholesterol and helps you to 'know your numbers'. We demonstrate pratical tips to support your cardiovascular health and promote a healthy lifestyle to manage or improve your health and wellbeing.
Trainer: Health and Wellbeing Team deivered by HALSA Wellbeing

Course: LHD - Learning Half Day - Healthy Hydration
Description: This Toolbox Talk teaches you about the importance of Hydration and the link to your Health, Safety and Wellbeing at work. You will leave armed with information about how much to drink, how to do self-checks to ensure you are adequately hydrated and tips on encouraging you to stay focused on hydration.
Trainer: Health and Wellbeing Team deivered by HALSA Wellbeing

Course: LHD - Learning Half Day - How to facilitate safe conversations
Description:
In this session you will learn practical tools to create spaces where people feel safe, respected, and heard. 
We will look at how to foster psychological safety, encourage open dialogue, and navigate challenging or sensitive topics with confidence. Ideal for facilitators, leaders, educators, and anyone guiding group conversations who wants to support inclusive, respectful, and meaningful dialogue.
Trainer: Health and Wellbeing Team deivered by HALSA Wellbeing

Course: LHD - Learning Half Day - How to prioritise self-care
Description: This session focuses on the importance of YOU and your Health and Wellbeing. We demonstrate how to make self-care habitual by using practical tips to support your overall health and wellbeing. The session covers the 4 key areas of wellbeing with tips on how to: Eat and Hydrate Well, Sleep Well, Think Well and Feel/Move Well.
Trainer: Health and Wellbeing Team deivered by HALSA Wellbeing

Course: LHD - Learning Half Day - I ache , managing pains in Menopause
Description: This practical sessions looks at the contributing factors to aches and pains that women may experience during the Menopause. We also look at how to manage these symptoms through self-care with a focus on eating and hydrating well, movement and stress management.
Trainer: Health and Wellbeing Team deivered by HALSA Wellbeing

Course: LHD - Learning Half Day - Men's Health Awareness
Description: This session aims to raise awareness and looks at some of the main health conditions which may affect men in their lifetime. There is a focus on both physical and mental health with some practical tools to help you stay focused on your health and wellbeing.
Trainer: Health and Wellbeing Team deivered by HALSA Wellbeing

Course: LHD - Learning Half Day - Rest and Restore
Description: During this interactive session staff will learn practical tips on how to promote healthy sleep habits and bring on a state of relaxation easily to aid restorative sleep.
Trainer: Health and Wellbeing Team deivered by HALSA Wellbeing

Course: LHD - Childrens Care Group Self Directed Study Declaration
Description: Please enrol on this to declare that you have used your learning half day to complete self-directed study
TargetAudience: LHD offer for Childrens Care Group Staff

Course: LHD - Learning Half Day Active Bystander Training
Description: This training helps colleagues understand their rights under the Equality Act 2010, recognise the bystander effect and different types of microaggressions, and learn practical ways to challenge inappropriate behaviour.

Course: LHD - Learning Half Day Cultural Humility
Description: This session supports managers to understand key terminology and explore how racism shows up within the NHS, including a look at RDaSH data. It includes group discussions and guidance on having culturally sensitive conversations. Managers will learn about the Cultural Proficiency Continuum, recognise bias and microaggressions, and have time for reflection and planning their next steps.

Course: LHD - Learning Half Day Rainbow Badge Awareness
Description: Rainbow Badge training helps staff understand how to better support LGBTQ+ people within the NHS. It explores assumptions and stereotypes, the purpose and progress of the NHS Rainbow Badge scheme, and the real experiences of LGBTQ+ people in healthcare. The session also covers the LGBTQ+ acronym, key terminology, and practical ways to be a visible and supportive ally.

Course: LHD - Learning Half Day Reasonable Adjustments
Description: This session explains what a reasonable adjustment is and who is entitled to one. It provides examples of reasonable adjustments in practice and guidance on how to identify when they are needed. The training covers the legal context, introduces the Reasonable Adjustment Guide, and explains the process flowchart and funding options. It also includes information about the Wellbeing Passport.

Course: 376 Volunteer Learning: Standard 1 Your role and responsibilities - once only
Description: By the end of this session you will be able to: describe your volunteer rights and responsibilities; explain why it is important to volunteer in ways agreed with your coordinator; identify how and when to raise concerns; explain the importance of honesty and reporting errors; describe responsibilities to supported individuals; and understand the importance of working within a team.

Course: 376 Volunteer Learning: Standard 2 ; Communication - yearly
Description: This course covers identifying good communication skills and avoiding common errors; improving team playing through effective communication; data security importance and legal compliance; defining and minimizing information security threats; identifying breaches; principles of good record keeping; identifying causes of conflict and communication's impact on it; dealing with assault; maintaining safe distances in conflict; and identifying organizational support for violent incidents.

Course: 376 Volunteer Learning: Standard 3 - Respect for everyone - 3 yearly
Description: This module explains the meaning and importance of equality, diversity, human rights, and person-centered support. It covers understanding different backgrounds to avoid assumptions and outlines actions individuals can take to challenge prejudice and discrimination.

Course: 376 Volunteer Learning: Standard 4 Safeguarding – 3 yearly
Description: A comprehensive guide to safeguarding adults and children. It covers the definition of 'adult at risk,' types of abuse, and identifying risk factors. It details the volunteer's role in reporting concerns, understanding child sexual exploitation (CSE), the PREVENT strategy for radicalization, and organizational procedures for managing safeguarding incidents.

Course: 376 Volunteer Learning: Standard 5 Mental Health, Dementia, Learning Disability - once only
Description: Explores the importance of sharing information regarding mental health and the consequences of failing to do so. It covers the prevalence of mental health issues, the impact of dementia, and different types of learning disabilities. It also identifies support sources and principles for improving interactions with individuals facing these challenges.

Course: 376 Volunteer Learning: Standard 6 ; Health and Safety - 2 yearly
Description: Covers health and safety legislation, policies, and procedures. Volunteers will learn to identify hazards, risks, and assessment methods. It includes specific training on fire safety, including characteristics of fire, evacuation procedures, use of equipment, and fire prevention practices.

Course: 376 Volunteer Learning: Standard 7 ; Fluids and nutrition - once only
Description: Explains the volunteer's role in promoting and providing fluid and nutrition. It covers food safety and hygiene, the importance of good nutrition for health and well-being, and how to recognize signs and symptoms of poor nutrition and hydration.

Course: 376 Volunteer Learning: Standard 8 Basic Life Support (BLS) - once only
Description: This course covers the essential theory and training for Resuscitation (Basic Life Support) specifically tailored for Volunteers.

Course: 376 Volunteer Learning: Standard 9 ; Moving and assisting - 2 yearly
Description: Focuses on the responsibilities for promoting safe moving and assisting practices. It covers identifying injury risk factors, demonstrating correct posture, the importance of good back care, and maintaining effective communication and teamwork during manual handling tasks.
